Comment:
GM Anish Giri , the youngest GM, against GM Friso Nijboer, a prolific chess book writer.

For Gameknot reader, this game viewer is serve as attachment in my blog http://red-white-chess.blogspot.com

A King Indian Defence setup. The theme of this defence by Black is to play a long chained pawn attack to White Kingside. White  is expected to castle kingside. For White, he is hoping to play a pawn advancing to queenside because Black's pieces is going to concentrate on Kingside. Let's see how this is going on this example.

Dalam pembelaan Hindia Raja, Hitam berharap bisa menyerang dengan bidak-bidak ke arah sayap raja. sedangkan putih berharap bisa memajukan bidak ke sayap ratu karena buah hitam akan lebih konsentrasi di sayap raja.

Unlike the Dutch defence where Black already get the f pawn advanced, here Black must spend some tempo to manueveuring the Knight so he get the expected f pawn advancing. This is to achieved a thematic pawn attack to Kingside

Tidak seperti di pembelaan Belanda yang bidak f nya sudah dimajukan. di sini hitam musti manuver kudanya sebelum bisa memajukan bidak f.

Black ignore the Rook attack and go to thematic pawn attack. 

Hitam tidak mempedulikan ancaman ke bentengnya dan memilih melanjutkan serangan utama ke sayap raja.

And White begin to harvest Black pieces because of his ignorance. Beside a Knight fork both the Black Rook and Queen also being attacked by other piece.

Dan Putih mulai memanen buah hitam, selain di garpu oleh kuda, masing-masing ratu dan benteng hitam juga diserang buah lain.

Black is on berserk mode and trying to activated another arsenal into battlefield. But after White Queen retreated it is clear that the Black Queen is trap. Correct will be 23..Nxe4!

Yang benar adalah 23..Nxe4. Dengan berambisi mengikutsertakan gajah hitam ke medan pertempuran, ratu hitam betul2 terperangkap.
Now the Queen had been sacrificed, Black only get more tempo to mate the King for compensation, but it is a promising attack?

Black losing important tempo by recapture the Knight here. Much more still fighting here is 27.. Nf3+ 28. Kxg2 Nd4 29. Qc4 f3+ 30. Kg3 Kxf7 31. Rd2 Nxb5 32.Qxb5. At this point Friso is about 5 minutes left.

Now White is a Queen up, but Anish still spend some times thinking the best deadly move. Here 28.d4+ is more deadly because it is open a diagonal to the Queen
